com.rigado.rigablue

Class RigLeDiscoveryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rigado.rigablue.RigLeDiscoveryManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRigCoreBluetoothCommon, IRigCoreBluetoothDiscoveryObserver

    public class RigLeDiscoveryManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IRigCoreBluetoothDiscoveryObserver
    This class provides a way for apps to discovery available Bluetooth devices and read the advertisement data present in their broadcasts. This class is a singleton and it is only accessed through the public static class method getInstance().

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static RigLeDiscoveryManager getInstance()
        Returns:
        Returns the singleton instance of this class.

      • startDiscoverDevices

        public void startDiscoverDevices(RigDeviceRequest request)
        Starts device discovery using the parameters of the device request. Be careful about restarting the discovery process too frequently. On devices running Android N, if scanning is initiated more than 5 times in 30 seconds, all scans are blocked for the next 24.5 seconds. https://github.com/AltBeacon/android-beacon-library/issues/418
        Parameters:
        request - The request for this discovery session
        See Also:
        RigDeviceRequest

      • stopDiscoveringDevices

        public void stopDiscoveringDevices()
        Ends the current discovery session if active.

      • getDiscoveredDevices

        public java.util.ArrayList<RigAvailableDeviceData> getDiscoveredDevices()
        Returns:
        Returns a copy of the current list of discovered devices.

      • clearAvailableDevices

        public void clearAvailableDevices()
        Clears the discovered devices list.

      • removeAvailableDevice

        public boolean removeAvailableDevice(RigAvailableDeviceData device)
        Remove an available device from the discovered devices list.
        Parameters:
        device - The available device to remove
        Returns:
        Returns true if a device was removed; false otherwise

      • setObserver

        public void setObserver(IRigLeDiscoveryManagerObserver observer)
        Sets the observer of this class
        Parameters:
        observer - The observer to set

      • isDiscoveryRunning

        public boolean isDiscoveryRunning()
        Returns:
        Returns true if a device discovery is in progress; false otherwise.

      • didDiscoverDevice

        public void didDiscoverDevice(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice btDevice,
                              int rssi,
                              byte[] scanRecord)
        This callback is received from CoreBluetooth when a device matching the request parameters is discovered. The data is converted in to a RigAvailableDevice object and then the observer is notified.
        Specified by:
        didDiscoverDevice in interface IRigCoreBluetoothDiscoveryObserver
        Parameters:
        btDevice - The discovered device
        rssi - The RSSI of the discovered device
        scanRecord - The scan response data, will be NULL if no scan response is avaialble

      • discoveryFinishedByTimeout

        public void discoveryFinishedByTimeout()
        This callback is received when the discovery operation times out based on the timeout specified in the initial discovery request. If no timeout is specified, then this callback will not be received.
        Specified by:
        discoveryFinishedByTimeout in interface IRigCoreBluetoothDiscoveryObserver

      • bluetoothPowerStateChanged

        public void bluetoothPowerStateChanged(boolean enabled)
        This callback is received if the system Bluetooth power state changes.
        Specified by:
        bluetoothPowerStateChanged in interface IRigCoreBluetoothCommon
        Parameters:
        enabled - If true, Bluetooth interface is enabled, disabled otherwise

      • bluetoothDoesNotSupported

        public void bluetoothDoesNotSupported()
        This callback is sent if Bluetooth Low Energy is not supported on this device or if the app does not have the appropriate permissions in its manifest.
        Specified by:
        bluetoothDoesNotSupported in interface IRigCoreBluetoothCommon
